extendedIngredients.name: belgian endive
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 lbs (about 6 heads) Belgian endive, ends trimmed and halved*
extendedIngredients.originalName: (about 6 heads) Belgian endive, ends trimmed and halved

extendedIngredients.name: egg
extendedIngredients.original: 1 egg, lightly beaten with 2 tsps water (for eggwash)
extendedIngredients.originalName: egg, lightly beaten with 2 tsps water (for eggwash)

extendedIngredients.name: puff pastry
extendedIngredients.original: 1 sheet (about 1/2 lb) puff pastry, thawed if frozen and corners trimmed off
extendedIngredients.originalName: sheet (about 1/2 lb) puff pastry, thawed if frozen and corners trimmed off

extendedIngredients.name: salted butter
extendedIngredients.original: 8 Tbsps salted butter, plus more for the pan
extendedIngredients.originalName: salted butter, plus more for the pan

title: Belgian Endive Tarte Tatin
summary: Belgian Endive Tarte Tatin is a vegetarian recipe with 5 servings. One portion of this dish contains around 3g of protein, 19g of fat, and a total of 473 calories. For $1.67 per serving, this recipe covers 5% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. 6 people have made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of belgian endive, puff pastry, butter, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. With a spoonacular score of 16%, this dish is rather bad.
